II. Purpose of Addendum
The facility has made renovations to the building, and has changed the program for
residents served.
III. Methodology
Visits to the facility were made by this consultant and by the previous consultant on
06/08/12 and 07/10/12. Fire safety approval was given by the Bureau of Fire Safety
Services. A variance was approved by BCAL on 06/28/12, regarding R400.4543(1)(d),
for inward swinging doors on all of the bedrooms. Conditions of the variance approval
include ensuring that all bedroom doors must be kept locked during daytime hours, and
must be left open during sleeping hours.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The facility has recently completed significant renovations to the building, including new
floors and doors, painting; the installation of a sprinkler system, and improvements to
the heating and cooling system. In addition, all bedroom furniture is sealed to the floor,
and all furniture and fixtures are in compliance with suicide prevention standards. Each
bedroom will sleep up to three residents.
The program, which previously served males and females in a secure residential
setting, will now serve males only, and will consist of the facility’s impulse disorder
program. All policies and procedures have been reviewed and are compliant with
licensing rules and contract requirements.
V. Recommendation
It is recommended that the facility’s regular license be continued at this time.
